#labels Featured
= Getting Started =

Want to contribute in development? Here's how to get started.

= Setup =

1.
You will need Linux with *Ruby 1.8.7*

The following Ruby gems are needed. (Rails version >= 3.0.0.rc2 should work)
  * abstract (1.0.0)
  * actionmailer (3.0.0.rc2)
  * actionpack (3.0.0.rc2)
  * activemodel (3.0.0.rc2)
  * activerecord (3.0.0.rc2)
  * activeresource (3.0.0.rc2)
  * activesupport (3.0.0.rc2)
  * arel (1.0.0.rc1)
  * builder (2.1.2)
  * bundler (1.0.0.rc.6)
  * erubis (2.6.6)
  * i18n (0.4.1)
  * mail (2.2.5)
  * mime-types (1.16)
  * polyglot (0.3.1)
  * rack (1.2.1)
  * rack-mount (0.6.13)
  * rack-test (0.5.4)
  * *rails* (3.0.0.rc2)
  * railties (3.0.0.rc2)
  * rake (0.8.7)
  * thor (0.14.0)
  * treetop (1.4.8)
  * tzinfo (0.3.23)

2.
Get the source using svn from here http://code.google.com/p/vaishali/source/checkout

3.
The source contains a directory called "tl". This is the RoR project.

Load sample events
$ rake db:fixtures:load

Start the rails web server with this command
{{{
chetanv@valmiki:~/work/vaishali/tl$ ./script/rails server
}}}

Open the browser at http://localhost:3000 and you should see the timeline.
